div.p:
All CFISD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year;
however, distance learning will continue through CFISD’s Learning at Home program through Thursday, May 28, 2020.
CFISD's Learning at Home Program. Distance learning will continue through Thursday, May 28, 2020.
CFISD continues to work with local, state and federal health officials to ensure the safety of students and staff. Latest updates and available resources.
In this week’s message, Dr. Henry updates the community on the impact of Gov. Abbott extending school closures for the remainder of 2019-2020. Read Dr. Henry’s message.
Student transfer forms for the 2020-2021 school year are now available.

Meet Cammile Adams: business owner, Olympic swimmer and CFISD graduate. Cammile’s parents chose Cypress-Fairbanks ISD to give their daughter every chance to dive in to exceptional academic programs and the swimming pool. Today, Cammile has two Olympic appearances under her swim cap and owns her own swim school. Her success shows how the opportunities available to all students in CFISD can develop champions.

Funds provided by CFISD Bond referendums are continuously strengthening the Cypress-Fairbanks ISD community. Resurfaced middle school running tracks, the newly dedicated and renovated Leonard Brautigam Center and the district's upcoming Visual & Performing Arts Center are just a few of the exciting ways your support is providing Opportunity for All in CFISD!
Online new student registration is now available.
